alternatives.transcript: on January 5th the epa's report on the health effects of environmental tobacco smoke was leaked to the Press on January 6th Philip Morris USA held a media briefing to refute the epa's claims and its scientific methodology on January 7th following the EPA reports official release Philip Morris USA produced a b-roll package and conducted a satellite media tour with television stations across the country to further publicize the company's position on ETS and
epa's report the following is a video compendium of media coverage p.m. USA received during this two-day period

let me list some facts for you fact 24 of the 30 epidemiological studies reviewed by EPA fail to support epa's conclusion in that 24 of those 30 studies did not report statistically significant increased risk of lung cancer

Fact one of the largest and most recent studies on environmental tobacco smoke was recently published in the American Journal of Public Health November 1992 that study was conducted with funding from the National Cancer Institute it was not supported in any way by any Tobacco Company the study specifically examined exposures of non-smokers at home exposures at the workplace and

jurors during childhood that NCI study reported no overall statistically significant association between ETS and lung cancer for any of those situations I mentioned that National Cancer Institute study is not even included in the EPA risk assessment if its data if the data from that study were included in the EPA risk assessment the overall one cancer risk
estimates from ETS exposure would not be statistically significant

fact of the 11 us studies on which the EPA relative risk calculation was based not one not one originally reported in overall statistically significant risk it was only after the EPA changed the rules and went back and lowered the statistical standard used by the study Zone authors that EPA was able to force the conclusion of increased risk

fact to put ETS in context if one assembles the epidemiological studies assessing the risk of drinking chlorinated water and applies the meta-analysis principles the EPA used on the environmental tobacco smoke risk assessment then one reaches the same conclusion as the authors of a recent study published in the American Journal of Public Health

namely drinking chlorinated water the normal drinking water of the vast majority of the United States produces twice as many cancer deaths than the lung cancer deaths EPA claims are associated with environmental tobacco smoke

the word from the Environmental Protection Agency is what many non smokers have claimed for years with this study the EPA now says that secondhand smoke is as dangerous as asbestos Arsenic and radar as expected the tobacco industry is firing back with its own studies that's a tornado and drinking water causes more cancer deaths than passive smoke today tobacco Representatives claimed the epa's conclusions are

clean motivated and just plain wrong if you look at it available scientific information today there was no risk of disease from exposure to environmental tobacco smoke Alexandra Schultz you would rather compromise and light up in designated areas but I wouldn't like it to hear that it's bad because I'd like to have the freedom to smoke when I'd like to and then there are others who say the EPA study is just to inconclusive to start a war I'm smoking I don't think is actually accurate I've been
around a lot of smokers enjoy it doesn't bother me a great deal
this is the 10:00 news
